lines.line: Do you have any quests for me? I really want one. I really want to help out!
My family consider what you did for us a great service. We couldn't possibly trouble you further.
There must be SOMETHING you need help with. I am a great adventurer after all.
There really isn't anything, I am very content with life right now.
I guess money really does buy happiness.
What was that? I didn't quite catch that.
Nothing...
Oh come on, surely there's something I can help out with! I want to help, however menial it is.
Okay okay. Fine then. Whilst I don't have anything for you, how about you try my sons, they are always wanting something done.
Fantastic! I'll get straight to it!
Have you spoke to Avan, Caleb and Johnathon yet?
Nope, not yet!
Hello there Avan, I've had a bit of spare time lately, and I was wondering whether you had anything I could help you out with, like a quest or something?
Honestly, everything is fantastic! What you did for me and my family is amazing. My lady was very impressed with the perfect jewellery you obtained for me!
You know, I really have a LOT of spare time right now. Anything, I will help out with anything.
I couldn't bring myself to trouble you any further. Thank you for everything, but I am content.
Very well, I'll go and see if your other brothers need anything...
I do one quest for you all and it solves all of your problems? Amazing... I'll go and tell your father how happy you all are!
Are you absolutely sure there is nothing I can help you out with?
Look, I really just want to get on with my life, your insistence on wanting another quest is getting annoying!
Caleb! As an adventurer, I am ready to help you with whatever you need... again! What can I help you with?
... and that's when I found the broken lamping stick. Maybe you could help me investigate?
Sorry, I didn't quite catch that, my mind was erm... elsewhere.
Well if you aren't going to listen to the problem, it's fine, don't worry about it. Nothing an experienced chef can't solve himself!
I'm sorry! Please let me help.
No! Not every problem in my life needs an adventurer to come solve it for me anyway. I'm happy and there's nothing else either!
Are you sure there's nothing I can do, a chef can always do with help in their kitchen right?
I'm a very competent cook! I do not need your assistance. Please leave me be.
I killed demons, I cured your poison and restored your family's honour! What can I help you with next Johnathon?
Actually, come to think of it...
Yes...
I've been having this issue. You see the lady I seek is trapped up the top of a very large tower of a very large castle, and has been for all of her life so far.
There is but one problem, a fierce dragon circles the castle, breathing fire at anyone who dares go near.
This is sounding like a great opportunity to be heroic, shall I go get her for you?
Ha ha! You would believe anything. That was just a children's story!
Very funny Johnathon, I can't help but laugh...
So do you actually have any problems I can help you with?
Everything is fantastic ! You adventurers really do seem to love quests, but I do not have one for you today.
Are you sure there's nothing I can do, perhaps even teach you about Death Rune magicks, where your skills do not live up to mine.
I find that very insulting. You do not need to remind me of your superior skills. Leave me be.
I have been and spoken to Avan, Caleb and Johnathon and none of them need anything from me!
That is excellent news. It's good to hear they are doing well.
Yeah... you're welcome.
Come to think of it, there is something you can help me out with!
Yes! I accept your quest!
Slow down. I haven't told you what it is yet!
I need 500,000 coins. Can you help me out with that?
You just want coins?! Aren't you wealthy! Why do you need coins from me?
Okay, I suppose there will be no time better than this to tell you the truth.
Go on...
Our family just pretends to be rich. We gave ourselves a fancy surname, pretended the gauntlets are a family heirloom and asked adventurers to solve our family issues.
Wait, so all of this was for nothing? You just lied to me!
No no, your work was indeed very helpful, the crest is important to us, it helps to portray that we are indeed wealthy, despite the fact we are not.
I mean, if you were wealthy, would you live in a tiny house in the darkest corner of Varrock? Not a chance. This is your chance to do us a final favour, may I have 500,000 coins from you?
I don't have enough coins on me.
Thank you very much. In appreciation, I will inform Avan, Caleb and Johnathon that you did yet another great deed for the family, and that you would find more pairs of those gauntlets useful.
Well this didn't feel very heroic...
You don't need 500,000 coins from me! I don't believe you! You can keep your rewards.
I will be here if you change your mind.
Our family just pretends to be rich Rautapets. We gave ourselves a fancy surname, pretended the gauntlets are a family heirloom and asked adventurers to solve our family issues.
Hello Dimintheis.
I will not forget what you did for my family. Those 500,000 coins have allowed us to put food on the table.
That's no problem.
Anyway, I was wondering if I could get more of those gauntlets?
You may, but you'll have to ask my sons for them, unless you just want a pair of the Steel gauntlets.
Yes, I do want a pair of steel gauntlets please.
Here you go.
No thanks Dimintheis.
I thought these gauntlets were a family heirloom, how come you have several of them?
I'm sorry for lying to you, it was just all part of the ploy to make our family seem wealthy.
They're not heirlooms at all, we have crates full of the things hidden away in the basement.
And you still think that these are an acceptable reward for what I have done for your family?
It's all I have to give...
Very well, I do admit, they are useful.
I have received word from my father that you assisted us again! I get the feeling you weren't going to stop trying until you did though.
As a token of my appreciation, I will happily forge you as many pairs of Goldsmith gauntlets as you desire.
You will find the rate you gain experience when smelting gold much improved whilst wearing these gauntlets.
Thank you.
I have received word from my father that you assisted us again! I get the feeling you weren't going to stop trying until you did though.
As thanks, I'll provide you with as many pairs of Cooking gauntlets as you wish.
You will find the rate you burn certain foods is much reduced whilst wearing these gauntlets.
I have received word from my father that you assisted us again! I get the feeling you weren't going to stop trying until you did though.
If you want, I'll provide you with as many pairs of Chaos gauntlets as you wish to say thanks!
You will find the power of bolt spells increases substantially whilst wearing these gauntlets.

characters.name: Avan
characters.description: Young adult male, refined British upper-class accent, polite but slightly dismissive tone, a well-dressed nobleman skilled in goldsmithing who values his romantic pursuits.

characters.name: Caleb
characters.description: Adult male, British upper-class accent, practical and slightly prideful tone, the eldest Fitzharmon brother who takes pride in his cooking abilities and doesn't like admitting he needs help.

characters.name: Dimintheis
characters.description: Middle-aged male, refined British aristocratic accent that slips when desperate, initially dignified but becomes humble and pleading, a nobleman who secretly maintains a facade of wealth.

characters.name: Johnathon
characters.description: Adult male, educated British upper-class accent, playful with a mischievous wit, the youngest Fitzharmon brother who enjoys telling tall tales and teasing adventurers.
